item.title: Are We Susceptible to Rowhammer? An End-to-End Methodology for Cloud Providers
enClosure: Group Communication via Encounter Closures
The Scalable Commutativity Rule
item.description: The scalable commutativity rule states that whenever interface operations commute, they have a conflict-free implementation. The initial SOSP 2013 paper included a full formal treatment of the rule, a detailed explanation of Commuter (an automated scalability testing tool), and how we applied the rule and Commuter to build a POSIX file system and virtual memory system. We are now exploring further the relationship between commutativity and scalability driven by the insights we gained from verifying the SCR.

item.title: A Revised and Verified Proof of the Scalable Commutativity Rule
enClosure: Group Communication via Encounter Closures
item.description:
The enClosure project is part of a larger project addressing EbN: Encounter-based Networking. enClosure is a service providing group communication based on encounter closures for mobile and IoT applications. We implemented a prototype implementation for Android and the Microsoft Embedded Social Cloud platform. Using real-world traces, we showed that enClosure provides a privacy-preserving, secure platform for a wide range of group communication applications rangingfrom connecting attendees of a large event and virtual guest books to disseminating health risk warnings, lost-and-found, and tracing missing persons.

This project was done on a Fulbright grant to Germany.

item.title: STO: Software Transactional Objects
item.description:
STO is a Software Transactional Memory (STM) that improves performance by tracking abstract operations instead of memory words.

Source code
